@laanwj Isn't 0.10.0 released ;)? Why did you tag this 0.10.0 then?\n
@diapolo Don't be so pedantic, I'm using it as marker for the next version on the 0.10 branch.\n

@diapolo okay :)

@sipa @fanquake Tried a Travis respin, still same problem on same configuration.

I'm also getting these errors when running the RPC tests locally with this patch:

```
bitcoind: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:110: void boost::recursive_mutex::lock(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_lock(&m)' failed.
bitcoind: /usr/include/boost/thread/pthread/recursive_mutex.hpp:110: void boost::recursive_mutex::lock(): Assertion `!pthread_mutex_lock(&m)' failed.
```

T

To give a bit of context, without this PR it is possible to learn all outbound peers of a node by repeatedly sending 'getaddr' messages. See the histogram for the timestamps of a ![full node](https://github.com/jonasnick/btcP2PStruct/blob/master/plots/full_node-histogram.png) and a client ![client](https://github.com/jonasnick/btcP2PStruct/blob/master/plots/client-histogram.png).\n
This comment is no longer correct, should probably be `Update the connected status for this node`\n
